position.marginalia_text: Perennis est motus, qui facit auem Lautam, et subtilem. Sic etiam piscis, purus, et delicatus.

marginalia.translation: Unending is the motion which makes the bird noble and subtle. Likewise, even the fish is pure and delicate.

position.marginalia_text: Volat avis in aëre: piscis in aqua: vir agilis in terra. Nescia virtus stare loco.

marginalia.translation: The bird flies through the air, the fish in the water, the agile man on the earth. "His virtue not knowing how to stand in one place."

position.marginalia_text: Pra[e]gnantiss[im]a Methodo, et pra[e]santiss[im]a Praxe; qua[e]uis ars statim fit facillima.
Da mihi vnicum mundi Artificem, et singularem professorem: qui solus omniu[m] est illuminatus Methodo, et Praxe; quotidana repetitione, incessanti

marginalia.translation: Give me the one craftsman and singular professor of the world, who alone out of all men is illuminated by method and praxis, by daily repetition, unceasing habit, and insuperable zeal.

position.marginalia_text: Hic est ille, qui singula expedit promptissimè; omnia exequitur potentissimè: cui nihil eorum difficile, qua[e] pla[e]riq[ue] omnib[us]
